ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Hardware
ygData.msgSnippet: I think a lot of the lag comes from their code, and not just our systems. Everquest is an old game, using older code, and some of that code has been modified
ygData.messageBody:
I think a lot of the lag comes from their code, and
not just our systems. Everquest is an old game, using
older code, and some of that code has been modified to
try and make the game graphics look like some of the
newer games.

I'm not blaming them, they're just trying to keep up
with what the players want (better looking graphics).
It's just that the original graphic engine is too old.
:)

3 gigs of RAM and a 3 gig processor... wow, I'd love
to have that, hehe.


--- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:
> For some reason I doubt it. I believe he'd probably
> still lag in the bazaar at certain points of the
> day. I wonder how much RAM, how much video memory,
> how fast a processor do you need before you DONT lag
> in the bazaar anymore? 3GB of RAM? Over a 3Ghz
> processor? I knoq pwoplw on DSL who still lag in
> the bazaar so I don't think that has anything to do
> with it. I'm on cable and I lag.
>
> Wulfric
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Melanie Johnson
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, August 11, 2003 10:18 AM
> Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Re: Hardware
>
>
> Oops, I stand corrected. heh.
>

> in
